intro: Galium jordanii var. collinum, commonly known as Jordan's bedstraw, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender, creeping stems and small, opposite leaves. The plant produces clusters of tiny white flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in dry, rocky soils and is often found in open woodlands and grasslands. Its botanical features make it an important component of its native ecosystems.
